com.qtfx.library.task.old

Class Task

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.concurrent.FutureTask<V>
      • javafx.concurrent.Task<java.lang.Void>
        • com.qtfx.library.task.old.Task
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Void>, java.util.concurrent.RunnableFuture<java.lang.Void>, javafx.concurrent.Worker<java.lang.Void>, javafx.event.EventTarget
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SampleTask, TaskList, TaskPool

    public abstract class Task
extends javafx.concurrent.Task<java.lang.Void>
    A task extension that exposes some additional and useful properties to monitor it.
    Author:
    Miquel Sas

    • Property Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Return the optional list of additional messages.
      javafx.beans.property.ReadOnlyStringProperty messageTime

        private double totalWork
        Privately register total work, necessary to avoid calls to properties.

      • messageProgress

        private javafx.beans.property.StringProperty messageProgress
        Progress message string property, set on the call to updateProgress().

      • messageProgressUpdate

        private java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicReference<java.lang.String> messageProgressUpdate
        Used to send message updates in a thread-safe manner from the subclass to the FX application thread. AtomicReference is used so as to coalesce updates such that we don't flood the event queue.

      • messageTime

        private javafx.beans.property.StringProperty messageTime
        Time message string property, set on the call to updateProgress().

      • messageTimeUpdate

        private java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicReference<java.lang.String> messageTimeUpdate
        Used to send message updates in a thread-safe manner from the subclass to the FX application thread. AtomicReference is used so as to coalesce updates such that we don't flood the event queue.

      • messages

        private javafx.beans.property.ListProperty<java.lang.String> messages
        List of optional additional messages.

      • progressDecimals

        private int progressDecimals
        Progress decimals for the progress message.

      • locale

        private java.util.Locale locale
        The locale to use build messages.

      • parent

        private Task parent
        The parent task when this task is submitted to a pool by the parent, to be executed concurrently with a list of tasks.

      • lock

        private java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock lock
        The parent lock.

        Returns:
        A boolean.

      • requestTotalWork

        protected void requestTotalWork()
        Request total work. The implementor, if it knows or can calculate the total work, must call updateProgress(0, totalWork).

      • updateMessage

        protected void updateMessage(java.lang.String message)

                              double totalWork)
        Overrides:
        updateProgress in class javafx.concurrent.Task<java.lang.Void>

      • updateProgressIndeterminate

        protected void updateProgressIndeterminate()
        An update progress call for indeterminate tasks.

      • updateCounting

        protected void updateCounting()
        Updates the progress message property with the token counting, useful for some tasks that spend some time counting the number of steps.

      • updateMessageProgress

        protected void updateMessageProgress()
        Updates the progress message property. In an indeterminate task it should be called per iteration, while in a determinate task it is called by the update progress methods.

      • getMessageProgress

        protected java.lang.String getMessageProgress()
        Return the progress message.
        Returns:
        The progress message.

      • updateMessageTime

        protected void updateMessageTime()
        Updates the time properties and the time message property. In an indeterminate task it should be called per iteration, while in a determinate task it is called by the update progress methods.

      • getMessageTime

        protected java.lang.String getMessageTime()
        Gets the value of the property messageTime.

      • getTimeString

        protected java.lang.String getTimeString(double time)
        Returns the time information string (seconds,minutes or hours).
        Parameters:
        time - The time in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        The time info.
